text: Sarkhej (सरखेज) Vidhan Sabha Constituency was one of the 182 assembly seats of Gujarat's Vidhan Sabha, in English the Gujarat Legislative Assembly, from 1975 until 2012. It was a largely urban seat representing there of Ahmedabad .Its abolition, along with others and new replacement seats were drawn up in 2008, in readiness for the next election which proved to be in 2012. ==Members of Legislative Assembly== {| class="wikitable" style="width:80%;" |- ! style="background:#666; color:white;" colspan="2"|Year ! style="background:#666; color:white;"|Member ! style="background:#666; color:white;"|Political Party |- |style="background-color: " | || 1975 || Bhavansinh Chauhan || Bharatiya Jan Sangh |- |style="background-color: " | || 1980 || Harishankar Pandya || Indian National Congress (I) |- |style="background-color: " | || 1985 || Nalin K. Patel || Indian National Congress |- |style="background-color: " | || 1990 || Harishchandra Patel || Bharatiya Janata Party |- |style="background-color: " | || 1995 || Harishchandra Patel || Bharatiya Janata Party |- |style="background-color: " | || 1997 (By Poll) || Amit Shah || Bharatiya Janata Party |- |style="background-color: " | || 1998 || Amit Shah || Bharatiya Janata Party |- |style="background-color: " | || 2002 || Amit Shah || Bharatiya Janata Party |- |style="background-color: " | || 2007 || Amit Shah || Bharatiya Janata Party |- || ||colspan=3|2012: Seat abolished |} ==Election results== ===2007 Vidhan Sabha=== ===2002 Vidhan Sabha=== * While Indian government's sites support these figures, they are almost certainly misprints. A vidhan Sabha constituency just does not have so many voters that the winner would poll 4 lakhs or even 2 lakhs votes. Lok Sabha elections tend to produce such figures. ==See also== * Naranpura (Vidhan Sabha constituency) * Gandhinagar (Lok Sabha constituency) ==References== Category:Assembly constituencies of Gujarat
title: Sarkhej (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
